subject: Philosophy
title: Frantz Fanon and Colonial Existence
description: A 60-second lesson on Frantz Fanon and Colonial Existence.

hook.text: Frantz Fanon used existentialism to dissect what colonialism does to the colonized mind.

buildup.text: In Black Skin, White Masks, he showed how racism strips people of their authentic selfhood.

discovery.text: The colonized person is forced to see themselves through the colonizer's gaze â€” always as 'other.'

twist.text: Sartre's abstract freedom means nothing when your identity is defined and degraded by power structures.

climax.text: Fanon demanded that freedom be material, not just philosophical. Liberation must be real, not theoretical.

punchline.text: Freedom without justice is just a word.

quiz.question: How did Fanon extend existentialism?
options: By applying it to colonialism and racial oppression
By focusing only on individual choice
